title.narrative: OUTPUT 2.1: EDUCATION ENABLING ENVIRONMENT

description.narrative: By 2024, the education sector uses solid evidence to influence policies, plans and budgets to reduce the number of out-of-school children and overage enrolment at early childhood and basic education for girls and boys, including adolescents., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid), Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024 more school-aged girls and boys, especially the disadvantaged, have equitable access to quality inclusive early childhood and basic education.

related-activity.ref: 2550/A0/09/882 OUTCOME 2:. EARLY LEARNING AND BASIC EDUCATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2024, the education sector uses solid evidence to influence policies, plans and budgets to reduce the number of out-of-school children and overage enrolment at early childhood and basic education for girls and boys, including adolescents.

description.narrative: By June 2020, 2500 copies of AE policy and curriculum was printed to be used to provide capacity building for over 175 ALP teachers to ensure access and retention of OOSC in Liberia. 5000 copies of the National Girls' Education policy revised and printed and dissemination to all schools. 6000 copies of the National community engagement and dropout prevention policy was validated and printed. Additionally, National teacher training policy was developed. To ensure the delivery of quality ECE programme, UNICEF supported the recruitment of a consultant to develop ELDS to regulate the quality of ECE service provision across the country. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/07/2020

title.narrative: Service Delivery - Early learning - ECD centres benefiting from UNICEF interventions
System Strengthening - Learning assessment - Existence of a well-functioning classroom assessment system, including for early grades - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - Learning assessment - Existence of a national/system-level large scale assessment, including for early grades - score (1-4), see guidance
System Strengthening - Teachers - Existence of government incentives for pro-equity deployment of teachers - score (1-4), see guidance
